About Me

I’m Tim Smith, a Designer, Front-End Developer and Broadcaster. I help organizations of any size to create beatiful websites, interfaces, and applications that work on a variety of devices. I’m available for work.

I’m the host of The East Wing which was nominated for an award by .net magazine two years in a row. I designed and built the CMS that powers Goodstuff FM together with Phil Duffy, which I co-founded with my buddies Chris and Adam. Given that I co-founded a podcast network, I host/co-host a few and I invite you to check them out.

Most importantly, I’m available for hire. I love helping people with design, front-end development, and podcast consulting. Learn more about hiring me.

Around the Internet

You can find me procrastiworking on Twitter, occasionally posting shots to Dribbble, or working on my contribution graph on Github. I jam out to my favorite tunes on Rdio, and share pictures of my life on Instagram.

Colophon

This site is published using the amazing Jekyll, hosted by Media Temple, and deployed with the help of Deploy. Fonts are served with Typekit, and posts are written with Byword.

If you’d like to work with me, have me speak at your event, write for your publication, arrange a time to get some coffee, or just say hi, please get in touch. I get a lot of email, but I try to respond quickly.
